title: 111_hr2274
content: The Act is titled the "Priorities in Education Spending Act" and pertains to elementary and secondary education programs. The "Priorities in Education Spending Act" repeals various provisions of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 related to family literacy programs, school libraries, Close Up Fellowship program, comprehensive school reform, school leadership, advanced certification, National Writing Project, and teaching of traditional American history. The curr_chunk lists various programs and sections of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965, including education technology, immigrant education, alcohol abuse reduction grants, mentoring programs, counseling programs, smaller learning communities, book distribution, and the Star Schools Act. The curr_chunk lists different subparts of Title V of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965, including programs for foreign language assistance, physical education, community technology centers, cultural exchange programs, mental health grants, arts in education, and more. The curr_chunk lists various subparts of Title V of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965, including programs related to healthy schools, additional assistance for local educational agencies impacted by Federal property acquisition, the Women's Educational Equity Act of 2001, the Native Hawaiian Education Act, and the Alaska Native Educational Equity, Support, and Assistance Act. The Early Learning Opportunities Act (Title VIII of H.R. 5656) is repealed, and higher education programs are addressed in the following section. The Higher Education Act of 1965 repeals various provisions including Alaska Native and Native Hawaiian-serving Institutions, Byrd Honors Scholarships, TEACH Grants, Default Reduction Management program, loan repayment for civil legal assistance attorneys, Thurgood Marshall Legal Educational Opportunity Program, demonstration projects for students with disabilities, and programs supporting postsecondary faculty. The curr_chunk discusses various parts of title VIII of the Higher Education Act of 1965, including programs related to college access grants, business workforce partnerships, early childhood education, STEM education for Alaska Native and Native Hawaiian students, college persistence pilot programs, low tuition, and cooperative education. The curr_chunk lists different parts of title VIII of the Higher Education Act of 1965, including programs related to job career bridges, grants for rural-serving institutions, training for realtime writers, modeling and simulation programs, success pathways, veterinary medicine grants, and Kupuna Memorial Archives. Additionally, it repeals provisions related to the Incarcerated Youth Program and the Underground Railroad Educational and Cultural Program from the Higher Education Amendments of 1998. The curr_chunk repeals various provisions of law related to cultural experiences grants, research in advanced information technologies, minority serving institution technology programs, and Olympic scholarships. The curr_chunk repeals sections related to literacy programs for prisoners, loan repayment for prosecutors and public defenders, career and technical education programs, Special Olympics Sport and Empowerment Act of 2004 program, and Head Start Act program. The curr_chunk repeals various education and training programs, including the Workforce Investment Act program, the National Environmental Education Act, and provisions of the America COMPETES Act related to teacher training, promising practices, summer education programs, and math and science grants.
